title: Plane Geometry Instructional Design Course Based on Socio-Spatial Context (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of elementary mathematics curriculum, mastery of basic geometric concepts, and foundational spatial awareness in social studies alongside historical and geographical context comprehension
context.additional_context: Focuses on developing plane geometry learning designs applicable to real classroom settings for pre-service teachers, particularly exploring interdisciplinary possibilities with social studies education to enhance citizens' spatial awareness.

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to analyze planar properties and perform logical reasoning in social contexts, such as urban spatial planning, using realistic geometric models.
Explain real-life problems, such as historical architecture or public facility design, by linking them to area calculations of plane figures through project-based learning.
Cultivate the ability to provide learner-tailored feedback and improve instructional design via formative assessment, thereby contributing to educational system improvements.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
